Description: Rectangular-sectioned timber carved into the form of a lion's head and chest. The lower part of the timber has been totally destroyed by fire. Wood coated in a layer of white plaster and painted in red, black and yellow-brown. Perhaps part of the decoration of an early Christian church.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Qasr Ibrim (Nubia), Unit C2 South Bastion Girdle Wall GWC-4 fill
Acquisition name: Division of Finds: Egyptian Antiquities Organisation
